toc_entry.title: Man To Man
toc_entry.description: The son’s ultimate selfishness is to see his father only as his father—not as a man. But on our first fishing trip in 25 years, I began to see my father—and myself—as the grown men we’d become.

toc_entry.title: Marilyn Snell’s Got the Best Job In Texas
toc_entry.description: It’s eight to five. It’s in Brenham. And all she has to worry about is getting an ice cream headache.

toc_entry.title: Eat At Junior’s
toc_entry.description: Proprietors of some of Texas’ priciest restaurants are spinning off more-economical eateries that are giving the originals a run for the money.

toc_entry.title: Primary Lesson
toc_entry.description: Subtract Democratic voters, add new Republicans, and it equals realignment.

toc_entry.title: No-Man’s-Land
toc_entry.description: To Texans, it’s the border. To Mexicans, it’s la frontera. It’s a hot, dazzling world where cultures clash and you’re never sure just where you stand.

toc_entry.title: The Native Texan
toc_entry.subtitle: Texas Primer
toc_entry.description: You don’t have to be born here to qualify. The mark of a true native is an undying passion to be one.

toc_entry.title: Mining the Moon, Selling the Stars
toc_entry.description: Their business may read like a sci-fi script, but these aging astronauts, former Nasa engineers, technocrats, and high-risk junkies are serious about selling space.

toc_entry.title: Boy Rogers
toc_entry.subtitle: Western Art
toc_entry.description: An interpretation of a classic genre.

toc_entry.title: Showdown In Chihuahua
toc_entry.subtitle: Politics
toc_entry.description: Pancho Barrio, an ex-accountant, a charismatic Catholic, and the mayor of Juarez, hopes to topple the ruling party in a July governor’s race.

toc_entry.title: Little Masterpieces On the Lawn
toc_entry.subtitle: Art
toc_entry.description: “Art Among Us/Arte Entre Nosotros” reveals the delightful madness of San Antonio’s barrio art.

toc_entry.title: High And Dry
toc_entry.subtitle: Movies
toc_entry.description: Top Gun is just a high-tech skeet shoot; Alan Alda throws a wet blanket over the fun in Sweet Liberty; Desert Bloom has bittersweet significance; The Manhattan Project needs an attitude adjustment.

toc_entry.title: My Fair Editor
toc_entry.subtitle: Books
toc_entry.description: George Bernard Shaw wrote a quarter of a million pieces of correspondence and never mailed one to San Antonio. So where does his editor choose to live?.

toc_entry.title: The Denton Dilemma
toc_entry.subtitle: Popular Music
toc_entry.description: North Texas bands face a tough choice: living to make music or making music for a living.

toc_entry.title: Behind the Lines
toc_entry.description: The unbudgeted carpet.

toc_entry.title: Shopping
toc_entry.description: We find a successful guy in Dallas who doesn’t dress like Ross Perot!.

toc_entry.title: Post-Modern Times
toc_entry.description: A Texas lab that looks like the set for a Buck Rogers movie is actually the frontier of the Star Wars weapons research effort.

toc_entry.title: Downtown
toc_entry.description: The cure for San Antonio’s inner-city malaise may be worse than the disease.

toc_entry.title: Around the State
toc_entry.description: A selective guide to amusements and events.

toc_entry.title: Reporter
toc_entry.description: Wild mustangs roam home; attorneys race to Houston’s bankruptcy court; Ut students get rich.

toc_entry.title: Touts
toc_entry.description: Perk up your bath hour with these liquid refreshments.

toc_entry.title: State Secrets
toc_entry.description: Fighting and feuding in the Mexican Lions Club; Hl&P loses a lawsuit, and everybody will pay for it; the new math of politics; where’s the beef? on a diet.
